instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont turn on with battery
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water damaged around <CHIP>U5000</CHIP> and <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> did not turn on

Reflowed and cleaned both areas and macbook turn on with adapter but wont turn on with battery

With known good battery and adapter:
-Screen shows low battery image, turn off and a sec and shows low battery image (loop)
-<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> 3.4V

Any suggestion?

Thanks a lot

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont turn on with battery
threads.message:
ALWAYS reball SMC when you found corrosion on its area.

Does the machine stay on with battery alone, if charger is removed?
Inspect J6950 for corrosion; be sure its pins are not half broken.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont turn on with battery
threads.message: Reballed SMC, its working ok now.
